routines.title: Strength, Cardio, and Functional
routines.subtitle: Elevate Your Strength, Cardio, and Functional Fitness with a Varied 7-Day Program
routines.description: Embark on a 7-day fitness challenge with a mix of strength, cardio, and functional exercises. It's a straightforward approach to elevate your fitness routine without the frills.

routines.title: Versatile Strength
routines.subtitle: Change Your Strength and Recovery with a Varied 7-Day Program
routines.description: Experience a versatile fitness adventure with the "Versatile Strength Series." This well-rounded workout plan combines a mix of traditional strength training, dynamic conditioning, and targeted core exercises, providing a balanced and engaging fitness routine. Elevate your fitness journey with diverse workouts that cater to various muscle groups, ensuring a comprehensive and effective approach to achieving your strength and conditioning goals.

routines.title: Multi-sport Performance
routines.subtitle: Functional Strength and Conditioning
routines.description: Building general athleticism to stay ready for the various sports you play.  This plan utilizes a concurrent training philosophy where we build strength, power, and endurance simultaneously in a single training split.

routines.title: Strength and Cardio Variation
routines.subtitle: Change Your Strength and Cardio Fitness with a Varied 7-Day Program
routines.description: Experience a dynamic 7-day workout plan designed to sculpt and strengthen your entire body. From intense upper body sessions to invigorating cardio and targeted strength routines, this plan offers a diverse and effective fitness experience.

routines.title: Golf Performance Program
routines.subtitle: Golfers are Athletes Too
routines.description: The best golfers in the world train in the gym to improve their strength, stability, and mobility to stay on top of their games.  You can too with this routine that blends full body strength training with dynamic mobility and cardio routines.

routines.title: OFFSEASON ATHLETE
routines.subtitle: Driving performance and physique
routines.description: This strength & conditioning program will help you develop athleticism while packing on lean muscle. The intensity of this program is high: you need to focus on clean nutrition and intentional recovery to be successful with this routine.

routines.title: Amateur Boxing Performance Routine
routines.subtitle: Functional Strength & Conditioning
routines.description: This routine is a general plan for amateur boxers looking to get in shape and improve performance in the ring.  Each workout is designed to supplement your boxing training to increase your stamina and power. If you box on any given day, separate boxing sessions with strength/conditioning sessions by at least 6hrs to maximize energy. Feel free to rearrange the days based on your personal sparring schedules, but don't schedule Red Zone Conditioning on days before or after sparring as you want your legs to be fresh.

routines.title: Foundational Fitness Protocol
routines.subtitle: Outlined by Dr. Andrew Huberman
routines.description:
Focusing on one key aspect of physical fitness critical for health and longevity and aesthetic balance each day of the week. It is designed to be modified to meet your individual needs, while still adhering to what the best science tells us we should all do for immediate and long-term health.

Dr. Huberman designed this protocol to address all major fitness goals, including strength, hypertrophy, endurance, and cardiovascular training.

routines.title: Longevity Routine
routines.subtitle: Comprehensive training plan to optimize your health and longevity
routines.description: For the health optimizers, this regimen balances all the fitness qualities you need to get in shape and stay in shape. Scientific research proves that strength training, low intensity steady state cardio, high intensity interval training, and mobility work have vast benefits to your physical and mental health. This routine incorporates them all in a balanced structure that you can repeat week-over-week.

routines.title: Abbott Performance Program
routines.subtitle: Functional Strength and Conditioning
routines.description: Optimizing the sport performance program for your basketball schedule.

routines.title: OrangeTheory x Yoga x Strength
routines.subtitle: Supplementing your fitness classes with strength
routines.description: Boutique fitness classes are great, but you may be leaving out a critical piece of your health: dedicated strength training. This routine balances out your OrangeTheory and Yoga classes with 2 additional strength workouts you can do at your local or home gym.

routines.title: Bodybuilding Routine
routines.subtitle: 6 Day Body Part Split
routines.description: This routine is an intense muscle building regimen that focuses on one body part per day.  Warm-up with light cardio and stretching, and use a light weight to warm-up each exercise before going into work sets.  Focus less on weights and more on completing the volume, and gradually add weight as you gain strength.

routines.title: Celebrity Aesthetic Split
routines.subtitle: Train like a superhero!
routines.description: This routine is inspired by the work of celebrity trainer Magnus Lygdback, who trains various actors and celebrities for on-screen roles and overall aesthetics. This routine will help you build muscle and get lean, while making sure you still move well.  This routine works for any gender, as you will work on building lean muscle through 3 strength sessions while improving your cardio with both steady-state and high-intensity conditioning methods.  Yoga is incorporated to promote mobility and help you recover between workouts.

routines.title: Upper/Lower Split
routines.subtitle: Four Day Routine for Hypertrophy
routines.description: This routine is great for adding muscle with just four workouts a week.  On upper body days, you'll work on chest, back, shoulders, biceps, and triceps.  On lower body days, you'll work on glutes, quads, hamstrings, and calves.  Feel free to add cardio, sports, or mobility days on non-lifting days.

routines.title: 4Day Push/Pull/Legs/Core
routines.subtitle: Tried and true routine to build muscle.
routines.description: The push/pull/legs routine is a popular training split that focuses on dividing workouts into three main categories: push exercises (targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps), pull exercises (targeting back and biceps), and leg exercises (targeting lower body muscles). This routine aims to provide a balanced approach to strength and muscle development by efficiently targeting different muscle groups on separate training days, allowing for adequate rest and recovery between sessions. We added a fourth day dedicated to core.

routines.title: 6Day Push/Pull/Legs
routines.subtitle: Tried and true routine to build muscle.
routines.description: The push/pull/legs routine is a popular training split that focuses on dividing workouts into three main categories: push exercises (targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps), pull exercises (targeting back and biceps), and leg exercises (targeting lower body muscles). This routine aims to provide a balanced approach to strength and muscle development by efficiently targeting different muscle groups on separate training days, allowing for adequate rest and recovery between sessions.

workoutCards.name: 5 x 5
workoutCards.description: A 5×5 workout comprises compound barbell movements — like squats and deadlifts — using heavy weights and lower repetitions per set. As the name implies, a 5×5 workout usually involves 5 sets of 5 repetitions. The goal is to build strength in compound movements by adding weight every time you do the workout.

workoutCards.name: Functional Strength
workoutCards.description: A full body strength workout that is designed to hit every major muscle group in multiple movement patterns.

workoutCards.name: Dynamic Effort Strength
workoutCards.description: The key intent for this workout is to generate force as fast as possible. By working on our rate of force development, we're improving our ability to generate power and be explosive, making the most of our max strength gains.

workouts.name: Barbell Front Squat
workouts.reps: 3 x 5 (can substitute with heavy goblet squat)

workouts.name: Weighted Pullups
workouts.reps: 3 x 5 (can use dumbbell or medicine ball for weight)

workoutCards.name: Functional Strength 2
workoutCards.description: 3 block strength session targeting full body.  Take full rest between sets on Block 1, so you can feel explosive on your box jumps.

workoutCards.name: Multimodal Conditioning
workoutCards.description: This is a high-intensity conditioning session focusing on getting to zone 5 (near-max) HR.  Work to rest ratio is 1:3, so you sprint 15sec and rest 45sec.  Try to keep speed/intensity same for all 5 sets of each exercise.

workoutCards.name: Heavy Strength
workoutCards.description:
Working on building max strength.  For the first 2 blocks, aim to increase weight each set, and work up to near-max on last sets.  We want full recovery between sets to maximize load on each exercise, so rest 2-3min+ as needed.

The last block is accessory work, so you can take shorter rest periods.

workoutCards.name: Active Recovery
workoutCards.description: Restoring the body with mobility and light movement

workoutCards.name: Strength & Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Hybrid circuit-style workout blending compound lifts, functional core work, and conditioning.

workoutCards.name: Off
workoutCards.description: Take a day off. Rest and Recover.

workoutCards.name: 30min Zone 2 Cardio
workoutCards.description: Steady-state low intensity cardio. Good for overall health and recovery.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Functional Strength
workoutCards.description: 3 block strength session targeting full body.  Take full rest between sets on Block 1, so you can feel explosive on your box jumps.

workouts.name: Wide grip pull-ups or lat pulldowns

workoutCards.name: 45min Zone 2 Cardio
workoutCards.description: Many of the top trainers and exercise scientists are pointing to the vast benefits of Zone 2 cardio.  It increases the number of mitochondria in your cells, and makes their function of creating energy more efficient.  It improves your cardiovascular health.  It helps you recover better in between intense workouts.  The downside?  It's boring.  But it's also easy, so take advantage of the health boosting effects of this method.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Functional Strength 2
workoutCards.description: Switching up main compound movements up.  Think of the Barbell Hip Thrust and close grip bench press as the key exercises in this workout, and maximize output on them.

workoutCards.name: 500m Row Intervals
workoutCards.description: High intensity conditioning day.  Start first 2 intervals at moderate pace, then amp it up starting on the 3rd interval.  Try to beat your last interval on each set.  After the 7 intervals, you'll take a longer rest period and finish with one all-out sprint

workoutCards.name: Full Body Strength
workoutCards.description: If you are feeling fatigued from the week, use lighter weights and focus on perfecting your form

workoutCards.name: Rest & Recover
workoutCards.description: No workout, but try to get some steps or light movement in to promote recovery.

workoutCards.name: 5K Run: moderate pace
workoutCards.description: Hit the road

workoutCards.name: Hypertrophy Focus Strength
workoutCards.description: The main goal of this workout is to build lean muscle with higher reps and higher volume work. You should feel a good pump after this one.

workoutCards.name: Core & Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Integrating HIIT with core work in two circuits.

workoutCards.name: Force Production
workoutCards.description: Working on building max strength. Do 1 exercise at a time with 2-3min rest between sets.

workoutCards.name: Active Recovery 2
workoutCards.description: Get blood flowing and lengthen muscles with foam rolling.

workouts.name: Full Body Foam Roll and/or Stretch

workoutCards.name: Explosive Strength
workoutCards.description: Focus on moving weight fast and explosively.

workoutCards.name: 5000m row
workoutCards.description: Steady state, easy pace cardio.

workoutCards.name: Hotel Hypertropy
workoutCards.description: Get swole with a quick, full body muscle-building workout.

workoutCards.name: Mixed Modality Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Steady-state cardio with multiple modalities to sweat out the weekend.  Perform each modality at medium (5) intensity.

workoutCards.name: Hump Day HIIT
workoutCards.description: Short but intense circuit to really elevate heart rate

workoutCards.name: Dynamic Strength
workoutCards.description: Building speed & power with explosive movements at lower reps.  Focus on lifting with maximum speed.

workoutCards.name: 5K Run: fast
workoutCards.description: Push the pace.

workoutCards.name: NTC Yoga
workoutCards.description: Easy mobility work

workoutCards.name: Max Effort Strength
workoutCards.description: Developing maximal strength at low volume to maintain in-season strength

workoutCards.name: Zone 2 + Accessory
workoutCards.description: Recovery from Monday night hoops with accessory hypertrophy work

workoutCards.name: Strength Circuit
workoutCards.description: Full-body circuit

workouts.name: Ab Rollout
workouts.reps: 3 x 12 (can use barbell or TRX as alternative)

workoutCards.name: Shoot + Accessory
workoutCards.description: On-court skill work and low intensity strength work

workoutCards.name: Dynamic Effort Strength 2
workoutCards.description: Building power and priming movement patterns for league games on Saturday.

workoutCards.name: Full-body Power & Strength
workoutCards.description: Focus on lifting explosively in the first block.  Follow up with accessory work to build muscle mass.

workoutCards.name: 4x4 Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Building anaerobic capacity with 4min intervals.  Go all out to reach max HR and focus on deep breathing during rest to return HR to baseline.  You can swap VersaClimber for cardio modality of your choice.

workoutCards.name: Get Strong
workoutCards.description: Lift heavy ass things. Take more rest between sets to ensure you can hit rep schemes.  The last block is more accessory so you can go for lighter weight since they are higher reps.

workoutCards.name: Jog
workoutCards.description: Nike co-founder Bill Bowerman wrote a whole ass book on jogging and its benefits.  Trust the founder and get some light work in to build conditioning and improve mood.

workoutCards.name: Kettlebell Strength Circuit
workoutCards.description: Full body strength circuit using only kettlebells.

workoutCards.name: Red Zone Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Mimicking the demands of a 3 round bout, this workout will be short and intense. The goal is sustain output at max HR levels, as you will in a real fight. Each round you will perform six, 15sec sprints followed by 15sec rest, totaling 3min per round.  Then you'll rest 1min and repeat 2x.

workoutCards.name: Boxing Strength Development
workoutCards.description: This workout will help you build full body max strength without gaining mass.  Focus on lifting heavy with good form, and getting plenty of rest (2-3min) between sets.

workouts.name: Low Incline or Flat DB Bench Press

workoutCards.name: Sparring
workoutCards.description: Boxing training day including sparring. If you don't have access or ability to spar, challenge yourself to imagine opponents when you're shadow boxing and doing bag work.

workoutCards.name: Boxing Power Development
workoutCards.description: This workout is intended to build your punching power.  Perform each lift with maximal speed and intent, at moderate weight. You should feel explosive during each set, and you should NOT feel completely fatigued after this workout.

workoutCards.name: Roadwork + Bodyweight Strength
workoutCards.description: End the week with a brisk 5K run and bodyweight strength circuit.  If you're feeling too sore, you can just do 2 rounds of the circuit or skip altogether.  Listen to your body and make the best judgment for yourself.

workoutCards.name: OrangeTheory
workoutCards.description: Hit the Orange Zone.

workoutCards.name: Yoga
workoutCards.description: Go to your local yoga class or use your favorite yoga app to get your flow on.  We love Nike Training Club (especially on Netflix)!

workoutCards.name: Full Body Strength Training
workoutCards.description: Working on full body compound movements to develop strength and muscle. Start out with moderate weight and longer rest periods between sets, and slowly increase weight and reduce rest as you get stronger.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Strength A
workoutCards.description: Gain strength and muscle with compound lifts at lower rep ranges, then finish off with accessory work with higher reps.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Strength B
workoutCards.description: Gain strength and muscle with compound lifts at lower rep ranges, then finish off with accessory work with higher reps.

workoutCards.name: HIIT: Tabata
workoutCards.description:
Working on building cardiovascular fitness with the Tabata method. Tabata is a form of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) that consists of performing 20 seconds of intense exercise followed by 10 seconds of rest for a total of eight rounds, or four minutes. The intervals will jump your heart rate up quickly, and with limited recovery time you'll improve your ability to repeat intense bouts of exercise.  

We recommend using an Assault Bike, Woodway Treadmill, Ski Erg, or Versaclimber for the most effective and safe equipment, but you can also use no/minimal equipment with burpees, jump rope, or just running in place.

workouts.name: Cardio modality of your choice (see details)
Cardio modality of your choice (see details)

workoutCards.description: Gain strength and muscle with compound lifts at lower rep ranges, then finish off with accessory work with higher reps.

workoutCards.name: Lower Body Strength

workoutCards.name: Strength Circuits
workoutCards.description: Strengthening total body with 3 training blocks.  Take minimal rest between exercises within each block and try to increase weight each set.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Pump
workoutCards.description: Full body strength session at higher rep ranges to promote hypertrophy.  Focus on good form and full range of motion reps versus lifting maximal weight.

workoutCards.name: Build Lean Muscle
workoutCards.description: This workout has two blocks with 4 exercises each.  Move through the circuits swiftly with minimal rest in between sets.

workoutCards.name: Quick Bodyweight Circuit
workoutCards.description: Short and sweet bodyweight circuit.  Perfect while you're on the road and need something quick and effective.

workoutCards.name: Functional Strength & Conditioning

workoutCards.name: Speed Endurance

workoutCards.name: Heavy Lift

workoutCards.name: Lower Body Emphasis Strength
workoutCards.description: Building strength and lean muscle witih compound lifts.  This is a full body session with a stronger emphasis on lower body to focus on legs and glutes.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Strength Session

workoutCards.name: Get Swole

workoutCards.name: Functional Fitness Circuits

workoutCards.name: Golf Strength B
workoutCards.description: Building full body strength starting with the back squat, which will allow you to apply force to the ground for powerful tee shots.

workoutCards.name: Golf Strength C
workoutCards.description: Focus on explosive speed over heavy weight on each of these movements.  This will prime your body to swing faster and prevent excessive soreness for weekend rounds.

workoutCards.name: Turf Training
workoutCards.description: Continuing to utilize functional movements to strengthen your knee and move better.

workouts.name: Sled Pull
workouts.reps: 3 x 50yd (slow and steady walking pace, add load each set)

workouts.name: Sled Push
workouts.reps: 3 x 50yd (marching pace with same load, increase speed per set)

workouts.name: Single leg squat off box/bench
workouts.reps: 3 x 8 (use light weight for counterbalance, start on lower box and progress with higher heights)

workoutCards.name: Upper Body Strength
workoutCards.description: Strengthen your upper body with a variety of exercises, including Dumbbell Bench Press, Chin-Ups, and Hammer Curls. Target triceps and core stability with Overhead Tricep Extension and Side Plank with Rotation.

workoutCards.name: Lower Body Strength
workoutCards.description: Focus on building lower body strength with Front Squats, Romanian Deadlifts, and Step-Ups. Enhance calf muscles and core with exercises like Seated Calf Raises and Russian Twists.

workoutCards.name: Rest or Active Recovery

workouts.name: Rest day or Light Activity (Walking, Cycling)

workoutCards.description: Take a break with a rest day or engage in light activities like walking or cycling. Enhance recovery with foam rolling or stretching. Practice mindfulness with activities such as yoga or meditation.

workoutCards.name: Active Recovery and Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Promote recovery with low-impact activities like swimming or light jogging. Improve flexibility with yoga, engage in cardio through cycling, and enhance mobility with drills.

workoutCards.name: Full Body Power and Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Ignite your full body with explosive power and conditioning. This workout includes Clean and Press, Box Jumps, and targeted exercises for biceps, ensuring a challenging and dynamic session.

workoutCards.name: Functional Training and Core
workoutCards.description: Enhance functional strength with TRX Rows and Bulgarian Split Squats. Target biceps with Dumbbell Spider Curls and build core stability with exercises like Plank and Turkish Get-ups.

workoutCards.name: Cardio and Mobility
workoutCards.description: Combine cardio and mobility for a well-rounded session. Boost cardiovascular fitness with the Elliptical and improve flexibility with targeted foam rolling and dynamic stretching routines.

workoutCards.name: Upper Body Strength
workoutCards.description: Build upper body strength with classic exercises like Barbell Bench Press and Pull-Ups. Target your back with Dumbbell Rows and focus on triceps with Tricep Kickbacks. Enhance forearm strength with Zottman Curls and finish with core stability in Plank with Hip Dips.

workoutCards.name: Lower Body Strength
workoutCards.description: Focus on lower body strength with Goblet Squats and Romanian Deadlift. Enhance leg muscles with Lateral Lunges and Calf Raises. Work on your core with Reverse Crunches and Russian Twists using a Weight Plate.

workoutCards.name: Rest or Active Recovery
workoutCards.description: Take a break with a rest day or engage in light activities like cycling or swimming. Release tension in the upper body with foam rolling and practice mindfulness with activities such as a nature walk or meditation.

workoutCards.name: Active Recovery and Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Opt for active recovery with a rowing session and enhance flexibility with Pilates or Yoga. Improve cardiovascular health with Jump Rope and incorporate dynamic stretches for overall conditioning.

workoutCards.name: Day 5: Full Body Power and Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Ignite full-body power with dynamic exercises like Snatch and Box Jumps with 180-Degree Turn. Focus on triceps with Close Grip Bench Press and challenge core strength with Plank to Pike. Conclude with the intensity of Sled Pulls.

workoutCards.name: Functional Training and Core
workoutCards.description: Integrate functional strength with Kettlebell Renegade Rows and Lunges with Medicine Ball Rotation. Focus on biceps with Dumbbell Bicep Curls and target triceps with Tricep Dips. Strengthen core muscles with Plank variations and Russian Twists using a Kettlebell.

workoutCards.name: Cardio and Mobility

workouts.name: Foam Rolling - Upper and Lower Body

workoutCards.description: Elevate your heart rate with the Stair Climber and promote flexibility with targeted foam rolling on both upper and lower body. Complete the session with a calming static stretching routine.

workoutCards.name: Upper Body Strength
workoutCards.description: Build upper body strength with Incline Dumbbell Press and target the back with Lat Pulldowns. Enhance core stability with Renegade Rows and focus on triceps with Skull Crushers. Develop forearms with Reverse Grip Barbell Curls and finish with Plank with Knee Tucks for core engagement.

workoutCards.name: Lower Body Strength
workoutCards.description: Focus on lower body strength with Hack Squats and Sumo Deadlifts. Enhance leg muscles with Side Lunges and Standing Calf Raises. Work on your core with Leg Raises and Russian Twists using a Medicine Ball.

workoutCards.name: Rest or Active Recovery

workouts.name: Rest day or Light Activity (Yoga, Cycling)

workoutCards.description: Take a break with a rest day or engage in light activities like yoga or cycling. Release tension with full-body foam rolling and practice mindfulness with activities such as a nature walk or meditation.

workoutCards.name: Active Recovery and Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Opt for active recovery with cycling and enhance flexibility with Pilates or Yoga. Boost cardiovascular health with Jumping Jacks and incorporate dynamic stretches for overall conditioning.

workoutCards.name: Day 5: Full Body Power and Conditioning
workoutCards.description: Ignite full-body power with dynamic exercises like Hang Snatch and Broad Jumps. Focus on triceps with Close Grip Dumbbell Press and challenge endurance with Battle Ropes Slams. Conclude with the intensity of Mountain Climbers and Sled Drags.

workoutCards.name: Functional Training and Core
workoutCards.description: Integrate functional strength with Landmine Rows and Reverse Lunges. Focus on biceps with Hammer Strength Machine Bicep Curls and target triceps with Tricep Pushdowns. Strengthen core muscles with Plank variations and Russian Twists using a Stability Ball.

workoutCards.name: Cardio and Mobility

workouts.name: Foam Rolling - Upper and Lower Body

workoutCards.description: Elevate your heart rate with the Rowing Machine and promote flexibility with targeted foam rolling on both upper and lower body. Complete the session with a dynamic stretching routine for enhanced mobility.
